website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive option is a solid choice for customers wanting a sleek and stylish keyboard tray.
pros: Crafted with a fashionable cherry finish
cons: Some customers have problems with the product arriving damaged from shipping, so inspect carefully when you receive it

customer_reviews.title: Wrong instructions, otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well constructed. Went in easy. Only problem was the cheap photocopy of instructions they sent. Part of the instructions were wrong since the step was already complete. With that, they did include extra screws. Not a difficult project. But i would have printed different instructions. Step 1. Attach sliders to board. Step 2. Place on table to be screwed to, and outline. Step 3. Remove sliders from board Step 4. Screw slider hooks (4) to the slider guides. Step 5. Screw slider with hooks to template outlined in step 2. Step 6. Screw (4) the board to the sliders.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: No Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: The cherry finish of this tray does not match the cherry finish of our office furniture, so I went to return it. The product is sold by Amazon.com and ships exclusively to Prime members, so you would think that the item would be able to be returned, especially considering there is no "no return policy" listed anywhere in the item description/details, but it is not. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Goods, poorly shipped
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, obviously misused and partly assembled by another purchaser; it was just relabeled and sent to me. The unit itself is comprised of heavy particle board with a hardwood edge, held together by twist & peg screws (a la Ikea). One of those areas was broken. Box included return instructions for the prior purchaser. Box itself was too soft for something like this, and had many holes and multiple tape-overs. I would suggest looking for this item from another seller.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Darby

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Microsoft ergonomic keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: One important thing to know is if you have an ergonomic keyboard such as the Microsoft one - this tray will NOT give you enough clearance to hold it and go under your desk. I had to get a couple of blocks of wood and make a spacer for this. at least two inches. The tray itself is a good color, doesn't roll as smoothly as hoped but still rolls out - I don't have to fight it , it just has more resistance than I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: IrishSa

customer_reviews.title: If you want to get more space on your desk this is what you need to buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice material, solid construction, cherry color looked very good. Mounting it was not as easy and the instruction was not very clear. I had to use extra screws and washers to mount the brackets. The height clearance was just enough to fit the keyboard and the mouse. It does not tug all the way in (with a little bit sticking out) but it's ok for me. Now I have more desk space to use the laptop along side with my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Trang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: The tray works beautifully under my wife's desk
customer_reviews.text: The tray works beautifully under my wife's desk. Unfortunately, she uses a Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard which stands too high for the limited space between the desktop and the shelf. The width was more than adequate. After installing a 1x2 spacer on each side, the shelf is doing great. Still worth the 5 stars as it is not the fault of the shelf she uses non-conforming hardware. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: The instructions which came with this tray is pretty useless. Apparently this company has one copy of ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions which came with this tray is pretty useless. Apparently this company has one copy of the instructions back at the office and they've photo copied it 500 times to the point where it's barely legible. It's no really loss though, because on top of that, they're very poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: A. rollins

customer_reviews.title: Had to modify on table saw to decrease depth.
customer_reviews.text: Tray is sturdy, but did not fit my Logitech K350 ergonomic key board. It was too deep for my desk unit, so I trimmed it and installed by drilling different holes to mount it on my articulating under desk arm. Works fine. The unit is not solid wood...it is particle board, so you have to be careful when inserting screws into the metal support on the desk arm. Could also use anchor to assure secure fit and retention for screw.
customer_reviews.author: SeniorSkier@72

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit a 23.5" opening.
customer_reviews.text: If the opening in your desk is 23.5", which seems pretty standard, this tray is not for you. The reason is, the tray itself is 23.5". After you attach the two 3/8" tray slides you are at 24.25". Then, after you attach the two 1" duck foot brackets to the slides, for mounting to your desk, you are at 26.25", 3" over the width of your opening. What you need, with these slides and mounting brackets, is a 20" tray. Also, with the mounting brackets in their lowest position, you will not be able to use a keyboard that is more than 1.25" tall, so that might also be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blizzard

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice - use care when assembling and pre-drill the holes.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware and directions could be better. Pre-drilling holes is important, despite directions not mentioning it. Directions also mention attaching the front trim piece, but that was already installed -- box did not look like it had been previously opened so I don't think it was a return. Screws which mount the slides to the side of the drawer stick out too far and can hit the slides if the drawer isn't pulled out perfectly straight. Looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: John Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, Could be wider.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to go with a mismatched desk set and they worked well. I had a little difficulty getting the two sides to click into place perfectly, but I was installing them upside down. I liked the quality and finish of the tray itself. I would give it 5 stars if it were just a little wider. It will not hold a standard keyboard with a standard mouse pad beside it. But is is the size advertised, Next time I will measure how wide I am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Surprisingly matched my current desk exactly. Easy to install. The directions are correct. One thing was they had already completed step 1 for me. Thanks for that. I may adjust the front drop angle after some time but for now it’s even front and back abs looks good. Had a small scratch in the front but I don’t care about that.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie R2

customer_reviews.title: look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Slide broke and came apart the first day. Even when adjusted to lowest setting, my standard keyboard still hit the bottom of the desk. ** Amazon won't allow a return even though this was listed as sold by Amazon.com !!
customer_reviews.author: anewman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, quite sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great sliding keyboard. The only caution I would add is if you are installing it under an "L" shaped desk, part of it may hide under the perpendicular section. It doesn't bother me, but if you're concerned, measure the opening before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Diane G

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, not returnable
customer_reviews.text: This broke during installation, very flimsy. Then come to find out you can’t return it, which is not mentioned anywhere in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Excessive

customer_reviews.title: Solid and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful keyboard, with solid construction, but I just can't give it five stars because of the terrible instructions. Additionally there was a couple minor but noticeable bubbles in the laminate on the front edge. Still looks great, I don't notice them looking down at it, but they are there. I would readily give it five stars if it appeared better cared for in the manufacturing process, and if the instructions didn't looks like poorly translated Chinese that assumes you should know exactly what to do. Which it is fairly self-explanatory, but decent instructions would have made the process go a lot quicker. Overall though it's very nice for the money, I would buy it again with no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A little wider tha expected, be sure you have enough width in your desk opening!
customer_reviews.text: this is a very nice tray, it did require that I cut about 3/4 inch from one end so that it would fit into the 25 inch space of my desk. That is because the brackets have about 3/4 inch tabs that stick out past the rails which are about 1/2 inch wide. So be sure you have either 25 3/4 inches or Know that you will need to trim one end. Otherwise this try slides easily and has a nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a few querks
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a work desk replacement. The color didn't quite match the photo, but it will work with our office décor. The screws on the side slide outs that hold the wood platform seem to catch on the metal glide. THIS is a problem with a lot of these types of trays. I love the item but it does not slide in and out smoothly and if you need to "tug" on this over it will need tightened or replaced.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, nicely finished wood
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, nicely finished wood, good hardware, reasonable price. Just what I needed for my latest version of an old desk tradition: a length of formica countertop supported by file cabinets or legs. This is plenty wide enough for a small apple keyboard and my mouse and pad. (With one of the wide keyboards, probably no space for the mouse.)
customer_reviews.author: P. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for laptop shelf, slides poorly for keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a makeshift docking station for my macbook, so I could set up a dual monitor display. I don't use it for a keyboard, just to keep my laptop and the wires out of sight. That being said, it works much better as a shelf than as something that needs to slide in and out consistently. The hardware is pretty cheap, and it does not slide smoothly. I took my time assembling and attaching it--still no joy. It meets my needs, but if you're using it daily for your keyboard, you may want to look elsewhere. I will say that the cherry finish looks very nice (note that it's laminate not real cherry, of course).
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with the keyboard tray, It already had a screw come off and after putting back keeps coming off. If I could return it I would.
customer_reviews.author: MAR

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and sufficient.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray is a nice addition to a desk that does not provide a place for the keyboard. The assembly was not simple, but I would not describe it as difficult. I can see where several reviewers stated it would have been simpler to install on a desk turned upside down. I was fortunate enough to be able to do that, and I would imagine lying under a desk to install this would be difficult. I would also encourage you to make sure about measurements.
customer_reviews.author: JByrd71

customer_reviews.title: Installation
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to measure the width you are installing into. The holding brackets extend out from the board so you'll need at least an extra 3" to be able to install the screws. Also, pre-drill the screw holes after carefully getting them aligned. That will make the final attaching much easier. The only Con: I wish the length of the brackets holding against the underside of the desk were longer to allow more finger room for my keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Slide fell apart before install
customer_reviews.text: Assembled unit as instructed, and as I was about to install it under my desk, the RH drawer slide fell apart and spilled all the ball bearings on the floor. I'll be a week finding them all. NON RETURNABLE???
customer_reviews.author: EricGF

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product and not too difficult to install although
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product and not too difficult to install although, I did some research on other customer reviews and took someone's idea and used the box-side to make a template so, I could drill my screw holes before attaching the tray. It matches my mahogany desk well, too. Only reason it didn't get five stars is because I would have liked the side hanging brackets to be longer leaving me more room for me to slide my hands under the desk to type on the keyboard without needing to pull the drawer out. Overall, I am very happy with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky-O

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable, but may be better off making your own
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tray for my new desk, and I must say it's just 'okay.' The material is wood, but the cherry color is just a cheap coating, so don't be too rough with it or it'll peel right off. It's also very stiff and hard to slide because of how the screws are designed. One MAJOR design flaw: the end of the tray has a large face designed to keep your mouse/keyboard from sliding forward too much, but instead it just ends up being a major pain in the wrists. I intend to saw it off, as it is super uncomfortable. Good price, though.
customer_reviews.author: zuiichi

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged!
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived as promised but even though the box showed no signs of damage, the item was damaged. The particle board had separated at an attachment pint and raised & split the laminate. the product is NOT eligible for return/refund so I'm out the $30.00! Would not recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice computer keyboard drawer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice computer keyboard drawer. Easy to mount and certainly strong enough for a keyboard and mouse or trackball. I mounted mine directly to my electric piano, I can now control the sequencing computer software and slide the drawer shut to play, PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Valley  Bob

customer_reviews.title: Get Your Desk Space Back
customer_reviews.text: Existing desk with small return and this kybd tray worked perfect. Tray is super nice finish and looks like real hardwood. Has nice front trim that comes up 1/4 inch to keep kybd from falling forward. Directions were typical chinese jimberish, almost looked like for another product, but I have installed hundreds of these. Install the rail glides first with supplied screws and use a small powered screwgun, etc. then hand tighten. Then assemble attach the side angle pieces, I use Locktite product and keep the extra hardware. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard roll out
customer_reviews.text: This is actually pretty gorgeous in person and works really well with my desk. Happy to have purchased! Better than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: If you're planning on using a mouse on this surface ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning on using a mouse on this surface, you might want to consider an alternative. The finish on the wood tray does not work well with an optical mouse, causing the laser to skip which makes your cursor constantly "jump" to another spot on the screen. Using a mouse pad to overcome this is not an option - there is so little height clearance that my mouse won't fit under the desk if I add a mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Browne

customer_reviews.title: Works Well But Smaller Than Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid keyboard tray that is easy to assemble and mount. It is not wide enough to comfortably fit a standard keyboard and mouse but it works fine. It works well for my desk that didn't have one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap hardware - bends easily and then doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: By the time I installed the keyboard tray, the hardware was tweaked enough that the tray did not roll in and out. Also, it's hard to see in the photos, but there is a lip on the edge of the keyboard tray (it's not a flat surface in the front), so you pretty much have to use a wrist pad with it. I was very unsatisfied, and there is no return.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm10

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good appearance, best installed by two people.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is fine, cherry finish fits in well, works exactly as described and is what I wanted. Why not 5 stars? Because installation is challenging. It will be best if you can turn the desk upside down, or at least have unimpeded easy access to the attachment area. It is best done as a two-person job. I did it by myself with much cursing. But now it is done and the tray is dandy.
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: Found Minor scratches on shelf
customer_reviews.text: Scratches from poor manufacturer handling or this item is second hand or a returned item. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sep Jane Yu

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, does the job. Bought it to install under a built-in desk in our current rental. Needed something decent but inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna A

customer_reviews.title: hoping it would work and it works great! It’s definitely made to last
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our corner desk, hoping it would work and it works great ! It’s definitely made to last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great material quality
customer_reviews.text: Great material quality, crappy instructions. I'm not an idiot and know where the screws *should* go, but the directions don't exactly confirm my assumptions. Once I mounted it to my desk, however, it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Photostefanie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: This is truly one of the best products that I have bought in some time. It was easy to install and works perfectly. Great job ?
customer_reviews.author: John B. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: useless, doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: terrible brackets, nothing fits right, they aren't the right length so its lopsided, and it doesn't come out far at all. wont give me my money back and its horrible. UPDATE! EVERYTHING BROKE WITHIN A MONTH OF OWNING IT WHAT ABSOLUTE HOT GARBAGE OF A PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Siavelis

customer_reviews.title: nothing wrong with the product but the installation can be ...
customer_reviews.text: nothing wrong with the product but the installation can be difficult if you are not at least decent with DYI type projects. If the tray isn't aligned just right the shelf will not go all the way back in and if you adjust the setting you can break the track if you aren't careful.
customer_reviews.author: KeZBiN

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Came with 2 right sliders, instead of a left and right slider, asked for a replacement, the replacement came with 2 right sliders, AGAIN. What are the chances of that? Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: instructions
customer_reviews.text: i received the product but the instructions were not very clear, nor was it easy to put together. no pre drilled holes to attach the rails, and its hard to get them to slide, no easy suggestions to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Short

customer_reviews.title: Putting this together will not be easy if you follow the product directions
customer_reviews.text: The drawer is very good. The directions are very very hard to understand, bad,bad, bad I saw pictures if the drawer in other places and used them to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Corby

customer_reviews.title: Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easily installed and fit and finish is fairly good. It fit underneath my desk well...much better than others that are available. It seems pretty stable to support basic keyboard and mouse functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, decent construction.
customer_reviews.text: Added this to a desk I purchased from another retailer. Looks like it came with it! Not the easiest installation but it’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hohauser

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a Keyboard and mouse tray. Could be a hair bigger for that purpose, but it's decent looking, was relatively easy to install, and is as described.
customer_reviews.author: JLD

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Matches my Studer (SP?) corner desk (cherry) perfectly...second one...I now use two computers so needed another keyboard shelf. Ordered the first one a year and a half ago and this one is identical. Great product. Smooth and easy to install. Oh yeah...fast delivery both times. No package issues...top shelf product and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, great price and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very Large (that's the reason I bought it), fits my large gaming mouse pad perfectly. Very well made, doesn't have that cheap-Chinese-crap look. I have a L-Shaped desk which comes with only a key board tray, like most of them do. I installed this one on the other arm of the L (easy enough install with a drill and some patience) to fashion a mouse tray on my right side. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: A. Dasgupta

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully matched my table
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, no instructions really needed. Just look at the pic here on Amazon and follow it. See pic for how it matched the cherry wood table i had. You can adjust the metal plate (if you already screwed it in, you can redo it even if you already drilled into desk) to make it higher/lower.
customer_reviews.author: the_arrow

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time trying to figure out how to put it together & when I finally figured it out the screws went through the bottom of the wood rendering it use less.
customer_reviews.author: JANET

customer_reviews.title: screwed into my ikea desk. fits my thinkpad keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: screwed into my ikea desk. fits my thinkpad keyboard and mouse perfectly and slides smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Poor instruction page but GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: If you're handy, this is an easy install. I fit that which is fortunate. But it's the best keyboard tray I've ever used. I love it. Slides well, feels like it's substantial (I had a plastic one that was maybe fifteen years old.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V. Beyerl

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard tray!
customer_reviews.text: The tray matches the cherry desk I recently acquired beautifully. The installation instructions that came with it were murky at best (a tiny piece of paper with a few pictures / diagrams) so I subtracted one star for that. I eventually figured it out and installed it. So far I love it, it fits both my keyboard and mouse/mouse pad, is sturdy and nice looking. Yes!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Lady

customer_reviews.title: Boss Keyboard Tray, Cherry
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but was very difficult to install. If you have a desk that you haven't filled up yet, turn the desk upside down, and the installation will be easy, but trying to install this lying on your back working over your head isn't going to be a pleasurable experience.
customer_reviews.author: D M R

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and large
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard tray. I have gone through 3 trays before this one: the rollers gave way or the plastic broke due to my knees always hitting it. This tray sits a little higher, is very sturdy and is roomy. I do not hit it as much with my knees. This tray feels like it will last. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a keyboard
customer_reviews.text: We installed this under a table in an office to house a keyboard. It opens smoothly, looks good, and it's very sturdy. It came quickly and was nicely packed. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Designer MomTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions but not hard to mount.
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, metal parts. Might as well throw away instructions because they are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Tray
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray is great. It looks really nice. Much more expensive looking for the price. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cindynan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice and is very sturdy. Looks expensive. Works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Keyboard Tray
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard tray. My keyboard was a bit too big to fit both it and the mouse, so we moved the mouse to the desktop. Great for typing though and I love that the height is adjustable to accommodate taller keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: F. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, simple, hard to put together, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cheap and hard to put together keyboard tray this is fine. It's not too stable, not too reliable, but it does the job. The instructions are the worst I have ever seen. You are much better off completely ignoring them. It is amazing that any company will send something out the door without a minimal concern for helping its customers. Most furniture companies learned their lesson and they now put together simple and easy instructions. Not this one. They saved half an hour of their time and added it to each one of their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Arno Maz

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations, just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the keyboard tray. The color is what I expected and it feels very sturdy. Docked one star because the instructions were not clear enough on how to put it together. I had to drill additional holes to install the rails, but it took me some research to confirm that I needed to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Install was easy and it works quite
customer_reviews.text: My husband attached this to the drawer space on my desk. We use it to replace a drawer that fell one time to many. Install was easy and it works quite well
customer_reviews.author: fandam56NC

customer_reviews.title: this keyboard tray is Boss!
customer_reviews.text: holds keyboards like they were designed to hold a keyboard! and they slide in under desk top quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It was great and then it wasn't. It fell right off the tracks and was hard to get on and then it fell off again and this time cannot be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But I would not recommend it to anyone that does not have tools to ...
customer_reviews.text: The manufacture did not predrill any holes in the Cherry wood. The product was received as a repacked item with the Cams already in place (THAT IS AMAZON quality control - none). I will keep it because I am able to create the holes and make it work. But I would not recommend it to anyone that does not have tools to create holes as you will have a terrible time with just an screw driver. Be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Pittillo

customer_reviews.title: Should be wider
customer_reviews.text: This is essential dated in the sense that most trays are designed now to accommodate a mouse next to it. So I had to mount another tray on this tray for my mouse to sit next to it. It's solid and good quality but it should still be wider.
customer_reviews.author: Kace

customer_reviews.title: Nice drawer though
customer_reviews.text: It was to wide and I could not use it. Nice drawer though.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Functional Keyboard Tray for My needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used model, so it's a little scruffed up. But who cares? It's just a keyboard tray. It is big enough and it slides out far enough so I have access the whole keyboard. That's pretty much all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Amorelli

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Solid and steady
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Solid and steady. Only problem is that it's not quite wide enough to accommodate an average size mouse pad along with the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: from tampa thanks amazon
customer_reviews.text: unit is very nice, love it. fast shipping thanks amazon!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: victor j.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and craftsmanship for me.It was an easy install. The drilling into the desk was a bit hard because I could not overturn the desk but I managed to do it with much complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Add on keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice keyboard tray that matches my desk perfectly. It was relatively easy to install. It is sturdy enough for my needs. There is plenty of room for the keyboard and hand rest pad. The slide mechanism works well.
customer_reviews.author: naturally healthy

customer_reviews.title: Small but Functional
customer_reviews.text: This tray will comfortably accommodate a single keyboard and is small enough to fit under most desks. It's well built, easy to install, and the wood is a lovely color. A nice addition to my office.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie B

customer_reviews.title: does the trick
customer_reviews.text: The mounts are a bit small and thin so after attaching under the desk the sliding tray is a little wobbly, but it's still sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: yystickers

customer_reviews.title: It is convenient and slides easily. Downside is there isn't enough room between the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is convenient and slides easily. Downside is there isn't enough room between the desk and the sliding shelf for the mouse to slide under the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Sedlar

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's desk. Easy to install if you can read diagrams without text.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't use it, wrong parts.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and would work great if they had sent the correct parts. Assembly requires a left hand and right hand slide...they included 2 right hand slides. I guess I'll just fashion my own keyboard drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M. Phelan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, functions very well and looks great. Quality hardware. Not for the directionally challenged! Fortunately I had help interpret their directions.
customer_reviews.author: Misc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I needed to do since the original one that came with the desk broke.
customer_reviews.author: ShinChan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: I love my Cherry wood keyboard computer tray I bought at Amazon. No more sore back from stretching and reaching for my keyboard and mouse. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: rollers poor quality and no holes drilled for fittings in board
customer_reviews.text: rollers poor quality, do not work smoothly and no holes drilled for fittings in board DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly constructed, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly under my U shaped desk to provide a second keyboard/mouse tray. I love it and it matches my faux maple desk too!
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaTechFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Matches my desk perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Matches my desk perfectly. Plenty of room for the Keyboard and Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne White

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, heavy duty and sturdy. About medium difficulty to install. It does the job it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lewis

customer_reviews.title: key board tray
customer_reviews.text: Had new furniture installed in home office and desks came w/o keyboard tray. ordered two and installed them. work fine.have used them now for 8 months or more and they work fine. would recommend them
customer_reviews.author: OL GRAMPS

customer_reviews.title: Big, sturdy keyboard tray...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out beautifully for us. Be prepared to spend some time lying on your back to get it installed...
customer_reviews.author: westwardster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find what I wanted for under the desk for the matching kitchen counter and this was perfect and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Attardi

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Tray
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard Tray worked great with the heavy duty keyboard slide! Nice heavy duty piece of wood. Also, the cherry finish was an exact match for the desk so it looks like it was made for it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Parent

customer_reviews.title: Definitely need two people to install. Sticky when pulled ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need two people to install. Sticky when pulled out all the way and sometimes crooked. For the price I guess it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tio

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. I use it as a second tray below my main tray to hold my Akai MPC Studio on it. It works great and its heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Powell

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard Tray Is A Bargain!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tray is a very basic one, but for a price under $30 it is an exceptional bargain. It was easy to install, is quite stable, and matches most desks in either of the wood tone colors. I purchased this item due to the positive reviews and you can add this one to the list.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, stylish, and a great complement to my popular studio desk.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy. It glides easily after installation. Much better than the plastic one I previously had. Installation went well as I've done this before. If you haven't, a second set of hands could be useful. All in all, a very good product although the room for the mouse on the tray is somewhat limited. However, it fits under most standard desks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: keyboard
customer_reviews.text: after a few !!!! words it installed. never did anything like this before at the age of 65. love my keyboard tray
customer_reviews.author: RNK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: had to send it back, color doesn't match up to claim.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletonkey IFOR

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The directions were terrible, the diagram in the directions were difficult to comprehend
customer_reviews.author: Edward R.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: makes typing so much easier, before my purchase, I had little to no keyboard space on my desk. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kareo Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Great tray
customer_reviews.text: This was a great tray. I loved the color, and the mechanics worked well. I've since had to move on to another that accomodated a larger wireless keyboard, but I was very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Swanson

product_meta.title: Boss Keyboard Tray, Cherry
product_meta.description: Color:CherryThe Cherry laminate keyboard tray can be used with any of the desk shells, credenzas or bridges. This compact accessory frees up work surface and stores the keyboard when not in use.
feature_bullets: The Cherry laminate keyboard tray can be used with any of the desk shells, credenzas or bridges
This compact accessory frees up work surface and stores the keyboard when not in use
Delivering a superior customer experience for our clients is as important as offering quality office furniture.
